body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
I created a service (type=loadBalancer, service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-type: nlb), but I found that can't change HealthCheckIntervalSeconds.

**What you expected to happen**:
In my opinion, when ingress nginx is updated, it may appear that the pod of ingress nginx has been terminated, but the health-check of NLB has not been completed, and there may be traffic transferred to the pod of ingress nginx that has been terminated. So I want to change the NLB target group HealthCheckIntervalSeconds to 10, to keep them consistent

- 1.ingress nginx
```
          livenessProbe:
            failureThreshold: 3
            httpGet:
              path: /healthz
              port: 10254
              scheme: HTTP
            initialDelaySeconds: 10
            periodSeconds: 10
            successThreshold: 1
            timeoutSeconds: 10
          readinessProbe:
            failureThreshold: 3
            httpGet:
              path: /healthz
              port: 10254
              scheme: HTTP
            periodSeconds: 10
            successThreshold: 1
            timeoutSeconds: 10
```
- 2.nlb targetgroup
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20660115/71453929-f1174d00-27c8-11ea-8eb7-8ab5b0ffd6fc.png)


**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

**Anything else we need to know?**:
My service configuration
```
kind: Service
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: ingress-nginx
  namespace: ingress-nginx
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/name: ingress-nginx
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: ingress-nginx
  annotations:
    # Enable PROXY protocol
    service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-proxy-protocol: "*"
    # by default the type is elb (classic load balancer).
    service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-type: nlb
    service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-internal: "true"
spec:
  # this setting is to make sure the source IP address is preserved.
  externalTrafficPolicy: Local
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app.kubernetes.io/name: ingress-nginx
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: ingress-nginx
  ports:
    - name: http
      port: 80
      targetPort: http
    - name: https
      port: 443
      targetPort: https
```

I found through [aws_loadbalancer.go](https://github.com/kubernetes/legacy-cloud-providers/blob/master/aws/aws_loadbalancer.go#L532) that it was set to 30s, but I didn't find anything that could be changed.

Excuse me, when I am in Kubernetes through service to create change HealthCheckIntervalSeconds NLB does not support?

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.14.6
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: aws
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):`Linux ip-172-26-110-194 4.15.0-72-generic #81~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Nov 26 16:34:21 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug): aws-cni
- Others:

- `/sig cloud-provider`

title: How do I modify the health check interval of aws NLB TargetGroup
